intro: Maranta striata, commonly known as the streaked arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves that display shades of green, white, and pink. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a starchy food source. Maranta striata thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
